us.title: Is The Stock Market Predicting A Recession?
us.content: The recent correction in the stock market has yet to trigger a clear recession warning for the US economy, based on a model that uses S&P 500 drawdowns. A probit-based model is currently estimating a roughly 5% probability that the US economy is contracting.

us.title: Actual growth slowdown will likely be worse than feared, says Andy Constan
us.content: Andy Constan, Damped Spring Advisors, 'Fast Money' to talk the Fed, inflation, tariffs, and the possibility of a growth scare.

us.title: Trump needles Federal Reserve after no rate cut
us.content: As tariffs work their way into the U.S. economy, possibly igniting an inflation headwind, President Trump suggests the Federal Reserve could better manage the economy with a rate cut.

us.title: DoubleLine's Gundlach sees more risk coming along with greater chance of recession
us.content: "Investors should have already upgraded their portfolios

us.title: TCHP: Don't Bother With This Underperforming ETF That Tracks The S&P 500
us.content: TCHP, an actively managed ETF by T. Rowe Price, aims to outperform the S&P 500 but has failed to generate alpha. The fund's portfolio closely resembles the S&P 500 with higher weights in stocks like NVDA, MSFT, and AMZN. TCHP has shown greater volatility and lower risk-adjusted returns compared to passive ETFs like SPY and VOO, and a high fee of 0.57%.

us.title: Interest Rates Stay Steady While the Future Grows Increasingly Uncertain
us.content: Tariffs and slowing economic growth lead to an unpredictable future.

us.title: Bitcoin Falls from the Shadows: Privacy Coins Now Dominate Dark Web Transactions
us.content: Bitcoin was once considered the dominant currency in illicit transactions. However, it is now being replaced by privacy-focused cryptocurrencies like Monero (XMR), Zcash (ZEC), Dash, and stablecoins.

us.title: Bad news Bitcoin bulls, the long-hoped-for retail is already here: CryptoQuant
us.content: Bitcoin bulls who still think the cycle peak has yet to come as retail investors haven't piled in yet might be using an outdated playbook, according to a crypto executive.“The idea that the cycle isn't over just because onchain retail activity is absent needs reconsideration,” CryptoQuant founder and CEO Ki Young Ju said in a March 19 X post.

us.title: Canary Capital Files for Groundbreaking PENGU ETF, Pushing NFTs into Mainstream Finance
us.content: Canary Capital has officially submitted an Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF) application to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for PENGU, the governance token of Pudgy Penguins, a popular NFT project. The filing, made on March 20, 2025, proposes an ETF that would hold both Spot PENGU tokens and Pudgy Penguins NFTs, marking a potential first in the U.S. financial market.

us.title: Bitcoin Slips to $84K as Post-Fed Optimism Wanes
us.content: Bitcoin Pulls Back as Post-Fed Optimism Fades; Ether ETFs See Extended Outflows Bitcoin retreated Thursday as market optimism following the Federal Reserves decision lost steam. The cryptocurrency fell 1.4% to $84,253.5 by 10:01 ET (14:01 GMT), mirroring broader risk asset movements.

us.title: Why these analysts expect no rate cuts in 2025, as corporate bond ETFs retreat from Fed-sparked rally
us.content: The Federal Reserve sparked some appetite for risk-taking in markets on Wednesday, but that seemed to fade on Thursday.

us.title: This is a tremendous opportunity to have a little extra cash, says Jim Cramer
us.content: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer talks this week's market action and how to navigate it.

us.title: Stocks Are in a 'Rolling Recovery,' Says Mike Wilson
us.content: Mike Wilson, chief US equity strategist and CIO at Morgan Stanley, says stocks could hit new highs in the second half of this year. He says markets are in a "rolling recovery.

us.title: Bitcoin Whipsaws Traders as Liquidations Surge – Is a Breakout Coming?
us.content: Bitcoin Faces Volatility as Liquidations Surge Whats Next? Bitcoins price remains highly volatile, with recent mass liquidations worsening market conditions.

france.title: BCE: Good Strategy And Bad Execution
france.content: BCE Inc. has underperformed the Canadian market by 35.1% due to a confusing debt strategy and macroeconomic uncertainties. Bell's high cost of equity, driven by a high dividend yield, is unsustainable without growth in both top and bottom lines. The Canadian telecom market's maturity limits growth, making the Ziply Fiber acquisition a strategic move to diversify and expand.

france.title: ETH: Have We Hit Rock Bottom Yet?
france.content: ETH has dropped nearly 40% year-to-date, with a 57% decline since December, reflecting weak market sentiment and declining public interest. Despite a neutral 'Crypto Fear & Greed' index, Ethereum's Telegram and search interest remain low, indicating weak demand and user growth. Capital outflows from digital asset investment products are at record highs, with ETH ETFs seeing consistent net outflows, though Grayscale's mini trust shows modest growth.

france.title: China's bond yields are rising — but economists say deflation worries could soon pull them lower
france.content: Chinese commercial banks are jolting customers with record-low interest loans to spur lending, while economists caution that a recent rebound in government bond yields is not a sign of reflation in the real economy. Several regional banks across the country have rushed to dole out cheaper consumption loans, heeding Beijing's call to bolster spending, as people sock away money due to shaky prospects of income growth.

france.title: Planet Labs Continues To Pare Losses, But Q4 Miss Suggests Being Patient
france.content: Planet Labs experienced a Q4 miss, with revenue $0.33 million below estimates and GAAP EPS 5¢ below expectations, causing a stock drop. Despite commercial sector weakness, defense and intelligence segments grew 20% YoY, and civil government grew 15%, with strong performance in Latin America. The company achieved positive adjusted EBITDA for the first time, signaling progress towards profitability, though GAAP earnings missed expectations.

france.title: German Biotech Firm atai Life Sciences Adds Bitcoin to Its Treasury Strategy
france.content: Germany-based biopharmaceutical company atai Life Sciences (ATAI) has announced its plan to allocate a portion of its treasury to bitcoin (BTC), joining a growing list of firms adopting a BTC-focused treasury strategy. ATAI Chairman Christian Angermayer revealed the move in a Substack post, citing concerns about inflation and market volatility.

france.title: Ethereum supply on crypto exchanges hits decade-low. Will ETH price recover?
france.content: Ethereum's supply on exchanges has dropped to its lowest level since November 2015, with just 8.97 million ETH available According to a Mar.

france.title: Uncertainty Hangs Over Fed, Inflation Needs to Stall for Rate Cut
france.content: Cooper Howard with @CharlesSchwab expects the Fed to continue cutting rates throughout the year. The rate of which will vary on data.

france.title: SEC's Official Statement on Ripple Lawsuit Still Pending: Here's What We Can Expect
france.content: Brad Garlinghouse, CEO of Ripple, recently announced that the SEC has finally dropped its appeal against Ripple, marking the end of a lengthy legal battle that lasted over three years. The SEC has decided not to pursue further legal action, confirming that Ripple is no longer under threat from the regulatory body.

france.title: Inflation will continue to be bumpy, expert warns
france.content: 'The Claman Countdown' panelists Steve Laipply and Scott Redler analyze the market's reaction to tariffs and discuss the U.S. Treasury yield. #foxbusiness #inflation #stockmarket #money
